cs.CC, cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.DM. 

The paper deals with the complexity and approximability of Max CSP, which is a fundamental problem in computational complexity theory and artificial intelligence. The paper uses algebraic techniques to prove that certain constraint languages make Max CSP have a hard gap at location 1, which implies that such problems cannot have a PTAS unless P = NP. This result is of interest to researchers in computational complexity theory (cs.CC), algorithms and data structures (cs.DS), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), machine learning (cs.LG), and discrete mathematics (cs.DM).
